description: From Middle English *rodeway, *radewey (attested in radewey-stile (literally “roadway-stile”)), equivalent to road +‎ way; road had the early sense of "riding" when the compound was formed, thus originally "a way for riding on".

entries.meaning: A way used as a road.
The main or central portion of a road, used by the vehicles.
The portion of a bridge or railway used by traffic.
